channel.title: [317] Mezzy (RUN)
channel.description:
Hello there, I have recently decided to get Mezzyscape and work on it, fix it up and mess around with it. I really have always liked it, but have never really gone to it until today. Anyways, I downloaded the Source/Client: ( http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,594414.0.html ) Fixed all the errors mentioned on the post with Eclipse... Then I set up the Run Configs for Client/Source... Then, when I try to run the client, it works just fine... However, the Source, isn't running or maybe it is, but I just can't tell because this is all that it gives me on Eclipse.. This is what happens when I hit "RUN" ( http://prntscr.com/7bb74n ) [CODE]
Usage: java com.rs.Server [debug/release] [gui/nogui] [/CODE]
I can't understand it really. Any help would be greatly appreciated. Thank you very much.

item.title: [317] Mezzy (RUN)
item.dc:creator: @malimt malimt
item.description:
@malimt wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:4, topic:551745”][quote author=malimt link=topic=670660.msg4484663#msg4484663 date=1433178890]

The source is asking you to give command line arguments, and by default eclipse doesn’t give any.
Here’s a link to the eclipse documentation on using Command line arguments

Looks like it wants you to supply either “debug” or “release” along with “gui” or “nogui”.

Ah I see. Thanks for the link, I took a look at it.
This may sound very dumb of me; However, I am still stuck on this, not sure exactly what to do.
I know it also may seem like i’m asking for too much “Help” It’s honestly because I have no clue what’s going on.
[/quote]
In eclipse, click “Run” in the file menu, and then click on "Run Configurations…"
Now in the GUI that just showed up, select the configuration that is for your source.
Underneath the “Name” field you will see some tabs. Click on the “Arguments” tab.
Now type in “debug” (with no quotes) and “gui” (again, no quotes) into the “Program Arguments” field.
Press apply and/or run. You should be good to go now.

It’ll look a bit like this:

I really need to clean out my configs, but ignore that.[/quote]
I already had the run config setup, but the missing part was ( debug gui ) Thank you as always. Your the best man!

Read full topic
